Reviews.Title: “Check those stairways.”
Reviews.Author: dcksnhere
Reviews.Content: I stay there often when I travel through Memphis, although in June, I was given a second floor room. To get to be disintegrating. I did notice some yellow tape hanging along the stairs, although not blocking them. Otherwise, I liked the motel. The rooms are clean, have a small kitchen, and are, for the most part, quiet. For the price, I am fairly satisfied, although I do prefer the first (ground) floor.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: masterforklift
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed here in Sept 08, not 09 but could only check 10 or 09. On our way to visit family in Clarksville and Soffolk, VA we stopped here going and returning home. As I had already booked all of our stops before we left CA and had only chosen by motel brand, I was not prepared for what we got upon arrival. I was tired from driving from Albequerque NM and was ready to relax when to my horror we were greeted form a scene from motel hell. People hanging out drinking and loud music, what appeared to be open drug sales and only God knows what else. We felt very unsafe there and carried everything from uor car to our room to keep it safe. The area felt totally unsafe. Everywhere we looked there appeared to be thugs waiting for an opportunity... They had security but we still felt unsafe as he seemed to be too friendly with the residents there. We have stayed at several other Studio 6 and Motel 6 before in our travels and have always had a pleasent experience. It was only at this one did we ever have a problem. The desk clerk did tell us that she would place us on the "good side of the property" I am very grateful for this site where I can research lodgings before I go there. I would not stay here again even if the room were free and I was paid to stay here. No price is enough for our peace of mind!!! Thank you Trip Advisor for your site:)

Reviews.Title: “No shampoo,non-working coffee maker to start!”
Reviews.Author: WalterB220
Reviews.Content: DO NOT stay there! One bar of soap, no shampoo. Non-functioning coffee maker(and they supply coffee only on the check-in day!)..If you want WiFi, they charge 4.95 a day(it was our understanding it was free)..Dirty carpet, and bugs. *I suggest you bring a gun into your room if you stay there* Also, IF you like loud,rude waitresses, you'll "love" the Waffle House next door!

Reviews.Title: “Roaches”
Reviews.Author: Candie2010
Reviews.Content: I arrived on a Thursday. The room was terrible. And the section of town was unsafe. The room was infested with roaches, they came and sprayed but it didnt help. Then toilet stopped up for no reason and I was moved to another room. The next room was on the 2nd floor and still more roaches!!! There was a guy on the first floor selling something out of his room. People would come up to the window and purchase what looked like drugs. I tried to move to another place but the Church Of God In Christ was having their annual convention and the city was booked up. I was stuck in this rat-hole until Monday morning. I WILL NEVER STAY AT THIS PLACE AGAIN!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs and Dirty Rooms”
Reviews.Author: obullenjr
Reviews.Content: There are Bed Bugs in the Room.

Reviews.Title: “Checked in...Checked right back out!!!”
Reviews.Author: chair28
Reviews.Content: My father-in-law booked a room here for 2 nights & we decided to join them...so we booked a room as well. When we arrived the front desk area seemed a little outdated. We FINALLY got 2 rooms next to each other upstairs. When we got to my in-laws room there were garbage cans in front of their door...what a site to look out your window & see!! Our room was next door...there was a view of the pool...we seemed to be in the getto...probablly 20 or so "kids" making all kinds of noise & I think they were all swimming in their clothes. We entered our room-supposed to be non-smoking...well...it was so stinky & old smelling...looked as though no one had been in there in a long time. We were thinking to ourselves...what have we gotten ourselves into...when My mother-in-law came into our room telling us that there was a ROACH in the bathroom...needless to say it didn't take us long to decide to ask for our money back & hit the ROAD!!! Don't stay here...!!! We found a Fairfield Marriott only a mile a way & so so so much nicer!!! Go there!!!

Reviews.Title: “A horrible place to stay, considering Memphis is a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: becky33173
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel, and it was terrible. It is a run down hub for the unemployee on welfare people. The rooms are rented on a weekly basis, and these people live there. They are all over the stairs doing each others hair. The room smell like food, because they are studios. The carpeting is dirty. This hotel should be taken off the list of hotels to rent for vacationers. This is low income housing for bragants and indigent people. This was a total dissapoitment, and our trip to beautiful Memphis was cut short, because there was nothing else available in town, and we had to move on to the next city. It was a true shame.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Unsure”
Reviews.Author: Totallykicking
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights for a convention. We reserved a non-smoking room but when we arrived they only had smoking rooms available. The room had a stale odor. The steps leading to the various floors of the hotel were unstable and there was trash around the grounds of the hotel. The paint on the stairs and the railings was severely chipped off. Our room door did not open without several good hard pushes. The lock on the deadbolt appeared to be broken. The door leading to the bedrooms would not be close all the way. There was no remote control for the bedroom tv and the tv could not be turned on and off manually. One of the dining chairs was broken. The walls in the rooms needed to be painted. We found a dead bug in the room by the front door. The kitchen area was pretty clean.

Reviews.Title: “read the reviews and stay away”
Reviews.Author: elitpunk
Reviews.Content: The room smelled terrible. There was pee in the toilet when we arrived. Bathroom/room door within the hotelroom would not close/lock. The hotel was loud. A lot of the guests appear to be living their permanently. The hotel is in a bad neighborhood. And a few guests appear to be selling drugs---stationed in the same places within and outside the property periodically throughout the day. Also, they are without a night manager which means no one is at the hotel from about 8 p.m. to 7 a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Dirty”
Reviews.Author: givennoname
Reviews.Content: I spent one week at the Studio 6 Hotel in Memphis, TN. The rate was wonderful ($235) for the week. The room was labelled non-smoking, and I was informed it was non-smoking; however, the room smelled strongly of cigarette smoke. The bathroom mirror had been written on in marker. There were stains on the sheets, and walls. Under the bed was dirty with food left by previous visitors. I did not not notice any bugs or living creatures other than myself. I inspected the mattress. The mattress was worn; however, it appeared to free of insects. I chose not to complain because by the looks of the place, all of the rooms would have been in the same shape. At times it was noisy. The hotel staff was friendly. They have security guards during the evenings and nights. I've stayed in worse places that were cheaper (in Central America). The pool looked older, but well maintained. It is very close to the airport. The "TV" selection was not bad. I watched lots of HBO! This hotel is cheap and therefore perfect for the single guy or guys traveling together on a road trip. I would steer clear of this hotel if I was traveling with my family.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: CTJ20
Reviews.Content: Though the room was cheap, it was not very clean looking. When we moved one of the beds, there were stains on the walls. The heat in our initial room did not work, therefore, we had to be moved into another room. And the elevator smelled really bad. When we requested clean towels, it took many hours for the management to get them to us because they stated that there were no clean towels available at the time.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room and great weekly rate”
Reviews.Author: Trukin_Lady_n_Wife
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of weeks to take a break from the road. We got a single room, which is the same size as a regular motel 6 room just with a kitchenette in the corner. The pros: great rate for a clean room in good condition, kitchenette, WIFI, pets friendly, grocery store nearby, seemingly decent area of memphis, security and friendly staff. The cons: front desk is available only during business hrs, cleaning is available only weekly, WIFI wasn't always working, and our first room had a few bugs but we were immediately moved to another room that had none. If I am in Memphis again for more than a week, I would definitely return here, but instead get the two room suite.

HotelInfo.Name: Studio 6 Memphis
HotelInfo.Address: 4300 American Way, I-240 at Exit #20, Memphis, TN 38118
